DOC.brief_summary: Study evaluate Efficacy Safety PreLipid® subject high normal blood lipid level
DOC.brief_title: Study Evaluate Efficacy Safety PreLipid® Subjects With Higher Than Normal Blood Lipid Levels
DOC.detailed_description: A Prospective , Double Blind , Placebo-Controlled , Randomized , Multicentric , study evaluate safety , efficacy tolerability PreLipid® , twice-daily nutritional supplement subject high normal blood lipid level
DOC.criteria: Newly diagnose Male Female participants high normal cholesterol level define American Heart Association , National Cholesterol Education Program ( NCEP ) ATPIII goal LDL cholesterol cut point therapeutic lifestyle change ( TLCs ) drug therapy different risk category : 1 . Age ≥ 18 year ≤ 65 year 2 . LDL cholesterol level > 120mg/dl 3 . Ability understand willingness sign date write Informed Consent Document screen visit protocol specific procedure perform willing adhere protocol entire trial procedure 1 . Stroke , myocardial infarction , coronary artery bypass graft ( CABG ) percutaneous transluminal coronary angioplasty ( PTCA ) angina pectoris past . 2 . Cardiac status New York Heart Association class IIIIV 3 . Uncotrolled blood pressure > 150 mmhg systolic > 100 mmhg diastolic 4 . Impaired renal function show limited serum creatinine ≥ 1.5 mg/dl male ≥ 1.4 mg/dl female 5 . Clinically significant peripheral edema 6 . Clinical evidence active liver disease serum alenine aminotransferase ( ALT ) aspartate amino transferase ( AST ) 2.5 time upper limit normal range ( 2.5 X ULN ) 7 . Participants steroid 8 . Pregnancy lactate woman 9 . Known hypersensitivity study drug 10 . Any malignancy within last 5 year , exception adequately treat basal squamous cell carcinoma skin adequately treat carcinoma insitu . 11 .
